name: quiescence
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of being temporarily quiet and not active: Through threats and rewards, he ensured the quiescence of Congress. a time of political quiescence See
quiescent
More examplesFewer examplesThe relative quiescence of the education faculty permitted him to ignore campus unrest.Public quiescence about this issue is because the economy is still strong.Her victory could rouse the party from its quiescence.
